summary: The State Department and the U.S. Agency for International Development have taken leading roles in providing assistance for the more than 5 million people who have fled the conflict in Syria. Most are now in Turkey, Lebanon, and Jordan. So far, U.S. assistance tops $3 billion. Much of that has gone for food, education, and health care. Some aid goes directly to refugees as a...
title: Syrian Refugees: U.S. Agencies Conduct Financial Oversight Activities for Humanitarian Assistance but Should Strengthen Monitoring
